com.marklogic.client.modulesloader.impl

Class DefaultModulesLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.marklogic.client.helper.LoggingObject
      • com.marklogic.client.modulesloader.impl.DefaultModulesLoader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ModulesLoader

    public class DefaultModulesLoader
extends LoggingObject
implements ModulesLoader
    Default implementation of ModulesLoader. Loads everything except assets via the REST API. Assets are either loaded via an XccAssetLoader (faster) or via a RestApiAssetLoader (slower, but doesn't require additional privileges).

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.marklogic.client.helper.LoggingObject

        logger

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DefaultModulesLoader()
      Use this when you don't need to load asset modules.
      DefaultModulesLoader(RestApiAssetLoader restApiAssetLoader)
      Use this when you want to load asset modules via the REST API.
      DefaultModulesLoader(XccAssetLoader xccAssetLoader)
      Use this when you want to load modules via XCC.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultModulesLoader

        public DefaultModulesLoader()
        Use this when you don't need to load asset modules.

      • DefaultModulesLoader

        public DefaultModulesLoader(RestApiAssetLoader restApiAssetLoader)
        Use this when you want to load asset modules via the REST API. The DatabaseClient used by RestApiAssetLoader should point to the modules database you're targeting; otherwise, the modules will end up in the content database.
        Parameters:
        restApiAssetLoader -

      • DefaultModulesLoader

        public DefaultModulesLoader(XccAssetLoader xccAssetLoader)
        Use this when you want to load modules via XCC. XCC is generally faster than the REST API.
        Parameters:
        xccAssetLoader -

    • Method Detail

      • loadModules

        public java.util.Set<java.io.File> loadModules(java.io.File baseDir,
                                               ModulesFinder modulesFinder,
                                               com.marklogic.client.DatabaseClient client)
        Load modules from the given base directory, selecting modules via the given ModulesFinder, and loading them via the given DatabaseClient. Note that asset modules will not be loaded by the DatabaseClient that's passed in here, because the /v1/ext endpoint is so slow - load assets instead via a RestApiAssetLoader or an XccAssetLoader passed into a constructor for this class.
        Specified by:
        loadModules in interface ModulesLoader
        Returns:

      • loadClasspathModules

        public void loadClasspathModules(java.lang.String rootPath,
                                 com.marklogic.client.DatabaseClient client)
        Specialized method for loading modules from the classpath. Currently does not support loading asset modules.
        Parameters:
        rootPath -
        client -

      • installAsset

        public void installAsset(org.springframework.core.io.Resource r,
                         java.lang.String rootPath,
                         com.marklogic.client.admin.ExtensionLibrariesManager mgr)
        This method is useful for when loading assets from a resource from the classpath. For loading modules from a filesystem, just use installAssets, which uses the much more powerful/flexible XccAssetLoader.
        Parameters:
        r -
        rootPath -
        mgr -
